greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Continued fraction expansion of constant x = Sum_{n>=0} 1/5^(2^n).
comment: Consists entirely of 3's, 5's and 7's, after an initial partial quotient of 4. These partial quotients are aperiodic.
example: Decimal expansion (A078886) consists of large gaps of zeros between strings of digits that form powers of 2; this can be seen by grouping the digits as follows:
and then recognizing the substrings as powers of 2:
